client

Class Communicator

  • java.lang.Object
    • client.Communicator

  • public class Communicator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to process all client information to send to the server, and acomplish the actual HTTP communication.
    Author:
    Kristopher Miles

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private AuthenticationWrapper auth
      Once the user has authenticated once, a wrapper is created and stored to save on future object-creation operations, since every operation requires the username and password.
      private boolean hasAuthenticated
      Whether or not any client has authenticated already.

    • Field Detail

      • hasAuthenticated

        private boolean hasAuthenticated
        Whether or not any client has authenticated already. If this value is false, any operation called with fail automatically without being attempted.

      • auth

        private AuthenticationWrapper auth
        Once the user has authenticated once, a wrapper is created and stored to save on future object-creation operations, since every operation requires the username and password.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Communicator

        public Communicator()

    • Method Detail

      • validateUser

        public User validateUser(java.lang.String username,
                         java.lang.String password)
        Authenticates with the server if the input username and password are both valid. Also creates the "auth" object to be used in future operations.
        Parameters:
        username - The Username to validate.
        password - The password to validate.
        Returns:
        A User model object if the user exists, null otherwise.

      • getProjects

        public ProjectListWrapper getProjects()
        Obtains a list of all projects from the server.
        Returns:
        A wrapped list of projects to show the user.

      • getSampleImage

        public ImageWrapper getSampleImage(Project project)
        Obtains an image from the selected project from the server.
        Parameters:
        project - The project we need a sample image from.
        Returns:
        A wrapped image file from the selected project, or null if the operation fails.

      • downloadBatch

        public BatchWrapper downloadBatch(Project project)
        Downloads a batch for the user to work on.
        Parameters:
        project - The project we are asking for a batch from.
        Returns:
        A wrapped batch containing everything the user needs to work on the batch, or null if the operation fails.

      • submitBatch

        public boolean submitBatch(BatchWrapper inputBatch,
                           java.util.List<Cell> data)
        Send the finished batch to the server to be added to the database
        Parameters:
        inputBatch - The batch we are submitting
        data - A list containing all the data we have created.
        Returns:
        true if the database is able to incorperate the data correctly, false otherwise.

      • getFields

        public FieldListWrapper getFields(Project project)
        Obtains a list of all the fields in a given project
        Parameters:
        project - The project whose fields we wish to list.
        Returns:
        A wrapped list of all the fields in the selected project if successful, null if the operation fails.

      • search

        public SearchResultsWrapper search(java.util.List<java.lang.String> search,
                                   java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> fieldsToSearch)
        Searches the database in whatever fields we wish to examine in order to find the pattern we have selected. May search multiple fields and for multiple patterns.
        Parameters:
        search - A list of strings we are searching for.
        fieldsToSearch - A list of the IDs of the fields we are searching.
        Returns:
        A wrapped list of the search results if the search is conducted successfully, null if the search fails or credentials are invalid.
